title: Foreign Catch Data (NAFO)
text: Data stored NAFO’s site stored STATLANT 21 database served user one two formats. Visit comparison data

title: Foreign Catch Data (NAFO)
text: Less detailed complete. years near 100% submission Contains information ANNUAL catches (metric tons) species, subareas/division, country, year. Data extraction tool provided select subsets data. tool allows output (export) data Microsoft Excel, PDF, comma-separated values formats. Catches broken month effort data fishing gear data. Example data:

title: Foreign Catch Data (NAFO)
text: countries submit. Especially USA. countries provide catch effort. Contains MONTHLY catch effort information year, country, fishing gear, vessel tonnage, main species, division, year. database large, Secretariat makes available web number comma-delimited text files containing ONE decade . mainSpecies field reported target species, however actual species caught specified speciesEffort Code field. column names changed decades: Code renamed SpeciesEffort 2000 onward GearCode renamed Gear 2000 onward DivCode renamed AreaCode 2000 onward Catches renamed Month_NK 2000 onward Country, Gear, Tonnage, MainSpecies, AreaCode fields contain coded values. description codes can found supporting files (exported data) Gear -> gear.txt AreaCode -> divisions.txt Tonnage -> tonnage.txt Country -> country.txt MainSpecies -> main species.txt SpeciesEffort -> species.txt Caution: format content supporting files changes decade decade. files tab delimited others comma delimited. files name switch tab comma delimited decades

title: Foreign Catch Data (NAFO)
text: Effort field ignored. Values “0 means effort data available 1 9 mean data (explanation difference) practice values seem used differently different time periods”. somewhat redundant since effort data recorded month. field SpeciesEffort help determine effort levels. example, SpeciesEffort = 1 - Hours Fished, total number hours spent fishing NAFO regulatory area = 2 - Days Fished, number days fishing took place. = 3 - Days ground, number days vessel NAFO regulatory area whether fishing = Anything else (Species codes listed species.txt). data shown 3 ton vessel Canada Maritimes & Quebec (Country = 2), using Bottom otter trawl (GearCode = 10), targeted American plaice (mainSpecies = 10), division 32, fished 74 hours June period 10 days (~7.4 hours per day) caught 38 tons Atlantic cod (Code = 101) 114 tons American plaice (Code = 112) vessel reported 67 hours fishing 8 days ~ 8.375 hours per day.

what: Use of NAFO data in comlandr
title: Foreign Catch Data (NAFO)
text: data database 21B used comlandr. Years missing data supplemented 21A Effort considered. species, catch aggregated countries (USA omitted) year. DivCode/AreaCode mapped Northeast United States (NEUS) Ecological Production Units (EPU’s). Gear codes mapped Northeast Fisheries Science Center (NEFSC) gear codes. resulting data merged NEFSC landings data.

title: Compare NAFO 21A & 21B databases
text: Data stored NAFO’s site stored STATLANT 21 database served user one two formats. differences explained package.

title: Compare NAFO 21A & 21B databases
text: NAFO spatial domain “covers large portion Atlantic Ocean, including 200-mile zones Coastal States — Canada, Greenland, St. Pierre et Miquelon USA.”. R package comlandr focuses Northeast United States (NEUS) shown fisheries statistcal areas defined Greater Atlantic Regional Fisheries Office (GARFO). NAFO divisions map NEUS domain shown second panel.  remainder document following figures based smaller area.

text: Catch USA reported stored NEFSC databases. Prior NAFO database comparisons catch USA removed. Catch divisions 4X, 5Y, 5Z, 6A, 6B, 6C (NEUS equivalent) area used. Aggregated Country Species 21A 21B

title: Overview
text: Data used various sources compile resulting data pull Commercial landings pulled Stock Efficiency Initiative (STOCKEFF) commercial landings module. product created maintained NEFSC population dynamics branch. Herring data comes State Maine. data updated periodically stock assessment scientist Catch international (non US) vessels reported Northwest Atlantic Fisheries Organization (NAFO). data pulled directly website. Observer data NEFSC used aid estimation discards

title: Overview
text: Commercial landings data resides Catch Accounting Monitoring System (CAMS) database maintained Greater Atlantic Regional Fisheries Office (GARFO). system officially launched 2022. Prior time landings data fragmented “snapshots” data (housed GARFO) stored NEFSC. source data stock assessments. Stock Efficiency Initiative created (prior adoption CAMS) goal consolidating landings data digestible form use stock assessments (amongst many things). STOCKEFF now incorporates CAMS data (post 2022) legacy data serve product stock assessments. comlandr uses STOCKEFF product exclusively landings data. reason align scientific products created Ecosystem Dynamics Assessment Branch (EDAB) stock assessments undertaken Population Dynamics Branch using underlying data source.

title: Overview
text: Herring data comes State Maine fully integrated CAMS (therefore STOCKEFF). comlandr, Herring data pulled separate source managed independently STOCKEFF.

title: Overview
text: Landings non US fishing vessels (foreign landings) within Northwest Atlantic waters managed Northwest Atlantic Fisheries Organization (NAFO). comlandr pulls data NAFO website merges US landings data detailed information regarding NAFO data please review vignette("ForeignCatch") vignette("ForeignCatchCompare21A21B")

title: Overview
text: Pull US landings commercial database (vignette("landingsUs")) Identify assign values missing data (vignette("missingData")) Pull Herring data State Maine (vignette("landingsHerring")) Pull Foreign vessel landings NAFO (vignette("landingsNafo")) Calculate species value (vignette("speciesValue")) Differentiate species reported group (skates, hakes) (vignette("disaggregate")) Aggregate statistical areas defined spatial region (vignette("aggregateAreas")) Aggregate fishing gears defined fleets (vignette("aggregateGears"))

title: Overview
text: reporting discarding legally required. However estimates required management. comlandr uses data Observer program help estimate discards. See vignette("discarding")

title: Overview
text: Although US landings data (SPPLIVLB) pulled STOCKEFF can retrieved early 1964, species value (SPPVALUE) available 1982. Prior date value can reliably validated. Menhaden landings complete commercial database.

title: comlandr
text: need ROracle installed configured machine. certainly possible define connection database much easier using package dbutils. Permissions several schemas eg. STOCKEFF. See vignette("schemas") details.

title: comlandr
text: can make connection follows: channel <- dbutils::connect_to_database(server="servername",uid="yourUsername") channel object inherited ROracle package. object passed argument functions comlandr

title: comlandr
text: Pulling raw data takes 15 minutes complete. see get_comland_raw_data details. pull raw (unprocessed) commercial data 1964 2023 resulting data object list containing several fields. See get_comland_raw_data details. removal fish parts optional removed default. Shellfish represented landed weight default (opposed live weight) Footprint returned data Statistical Area Note: Herring Menhaden data underrepresented raw data pull. Herring data pulled separately another database. Menhaden excluded due confidentiality concerns

title: comlandr
text: pull processed raw data, use get_comland_data pull raw data () process depending input arguments supplied. options processing : Include Herring data Remove fish parts Include foreign landings NAFO Adjust species value based reference year Separate skate hake landings species based survey proportions Aggregate landings user defined groupings Statistical areas Aggregate gear codes based user supplied fleets Attempt assign values missing data See articles section depth explanation components comlandr

title: Tease apart unclassified groups of species
text: Skate species bottom trawl survey identified SVSPP codes = 22:28 location bottom trawl tows (SPRING FALL) assigned statistical areas landings reported. proportion caught (biomass) season applied commercial landings (SPPLIVWT) value (SPPVALUE) unclassified skates (NESPP3 = 365) assigned little skate (NESPP3 = 366) winter skate (NESPP3 = 367). remained left unclassified.

title: Tease apart unclassified groups of species
text: process applied hake species Offshore hake (SVSPP = 69) silver hake (SVSPP = 72) Commercial data base code unclassified hakes (NESPP3 = 507). Resulting landings assigned offshore hake (NESPP3 = 508) silver hake (NESPP3 = 509)

title: Landings by foreign vessels in US waters
text: US data removed Data missing MONTH field assigned, MONTH = 0 QY= 1 Data aggregated country codes Data filtered keep Division codes = c(47, 51:56, 61:63) (See vignette("ForeignCatchCompare21A21B")) Missing data 21B data substituted 21A assigned MONTH = 0 QY= 1 Codes present NAFO data defined lookup tables matched manually NAFO species codes used catch alls, example Groundfish (specified), assigned corresponding NESPP3 codes shellfish reported live weight. conversion meat weight applied useLanded supplied. Herring data removed (since State Maine database account Herring landings, see vignette("landingsHerring")) Mismatched codes manually adjusted Vessel tonnage class codes NAFO data matched TONCL2 codes. Additional missing fields (SPPVALUE,UTILCD, MESHCAT,MARKET_CODE) set missing

what: Pulls and processes commercial fishing data from the Northeast US
title: Pulls and processes commercial fishing data from the Northeast US
text: comlandr allows users pull process commercial fishing data Northeast USA. Northwest Atlantic Fisheries Organization (NAFO) data included capture landings non US fleets US waters. use package need: behind NEFSC firewall Permissions access required server/databases: username password. Permissions access schema/tables Oracle’s instant Client installed Oracle’s R package ROracle installed “product uses FRED® API endorsed certified Federal Reserve Bank St. Louis.”

title: comlandr: Pull and process commercial fisheries data — comlandr-package
text: Pulls data StockEff Pulls Herring data state Maine database Defines fleet structure assigns fleets gear types Define geographic areas assigns statistical areas geographic areas Assigns landings unknown gear, area, quarter/half year, size based similar trips (based M Palmer, 2008 Working paper) Pulls processes NAFO (Northwest Atlantic Fisheries Organization) data Uses survey data apportion hake complex species Uses survey data apportion skate complex species Uses observer data estimate discards Adjusts species value specified date

title: Extract AREA information from CFDBS — get_areas
Extract AREA information from CFDBS — get_areas
text: channel Object inherited ROracle::Oracle. object used connect communicate database engine. (see dbutils::connect_to_database) areas specific area code set codes. Either numeric character vector. Defaults "" areas Numeric codes converted VARCHAR2(3 BYTE) creating sql statement. Character codes short character strings reference AREANM field.

title: Extract AREA information from CFDBS — get_areas
text: list returned: data containing result executed sqlStatement sql containing sql call colNames vector table's column names default sql statement "select * NEFSC_GARFO.cfdbs_area" used

title: Extract AREA information from CFDBS — get_areas
text: Use data dictionary field name explanations

title: Extract AREA information from CFDBS — get_areas
code: if (FALSE) { # \dontrun{ # extracts complete area table based on default sql statement channel <- connect_to_database(server="name_of_server",uid="individuals_username") get_areas(channel)  # extracts a subset of area data based on selected areas 100,500 (numeric) get_areas(channel,areas=c(100,500))  # extracts a subset of area data based on selected areas 100,500 (character) get_areas(channel,areas=c("100","500"))  # extracts a subset of area data based on areanm's containing "GG" (Androscoggin River etc) get_areas(channel,"GG")  } # }

what: Extracts commercial discard data from Database — get_comdisc_data
title: Extracts commercial discard data from Database — get_comdisc_data
text: Connects obdbs pulls discard data, calculates discard kept ratios, applies landings data obtained using get_comland_data.

title: Extracts commercial discard data from Database — get_comdisc_data
code: get_comdisc_data(   channel,   comland,   aggArea = F,   areaDescription = "EPU",   propDescription = "MeanProp",   aggGear = F,   fleetDescription = "Fleet",   extendTS = T )

title: Extracts commercial discard data from Database — get_comdisc_data
text: channel Object inherited ROracle::Oracle. object used connect communicate database engine. (see dbutils::connect_to_database) comland Data frame. Result get_comland_data aggArea boolean. Aggregate Statistical Areas larger spatial units (Default = F) areaDescription character string. Field name userAreas denoting spatial unit. (Default = "EPU") propDescription character string. Field name userAreas denoting scaling factor. (Default = "MeanProp") aggGear boolean. Aggregate NEGEAR codes larger "fleets" (Default = F) fleetDescription character string. Field name userGears denoting Fleet. (Default = "Fleet") extendTS Boolean. DK (Discard kept) ratio extended applied landings beyond observer coverage time period (Discards started 1989). Default = T

title: Extracts commercial discard data from Database — get_comdisc_data
text: Data frame (data.table) (n x 10) row data.table represents species record given tow/trip YEAR Year trip/tow MONTH Month trip/tow NEGEAR Fishing gear used trip/tow TONCL1 Tonnage class fishing vessel NESPP3 Species code (3 charachters) NESPP4 Species code market code (4 characters) AREA Statistical area species reportly caught UTILCD Utilization code SPPLIVLB live weight (landed = "n") landed weight (landed="y") lbs SPPVALUE value landed catch nearest dollar (U.S.), paid fisherman dealer, given species.

Extracts observer data from Database — get_comdisc_raw_data

title: Extracts observer data from Database — get_comdisc_raw_data
text: Data frame (data.table) (n x 10) row data.table represents species record given tow/trip YEAR Year trip/tow MONTH Month trip/tow NEGEAR Fishing gear used trip/tow TONCL1 Tonnage class fishing vessel NESPP3 Species code (3 charachters) NESPP4 Species code market code (4 characters) AREA Statistical area species reportly caught UTILCD Utilization code SPPLIVLB live weight (landed = "n") landed weight (landed="y") lbs SPPVALUE value landed catch nearest dollar (U.S.), paid fisherman dealer, given species.

what: Extracts and processes commercial data from Database — get_comland_data
title: Extracts and processes commercial data from Database — get_comland_data
text: Connects Population dynamics Database STOCKEFF pull US landings data. Data also pulled NAFO (foreign landings) State Maine (Herring). sources data aggregated, species value adjusted user defined reference year, skate hake landings (often reported unclassified category) split based bottom trawl survey, missing values imputed. information regarding methods see vignette("Overview")

title: Extracts and processes commercial data from Database — get_comland_data
code: get_comland_data(   channel,   filterByYear = NA,   filterByArea = NA,   useLanded = T,   removeParts = T,   useHerringMaine = T,   useForeign = T,   refYear = NA,   refMonth = NA,   disagSkatesHakes = T,   aggArea = F,   userAreas = comlandr::mskeyAreas,   areaDescription = "EPU",   propDescription = "MeanProp",   applyProp = F,   aggGear = F,   userGears = comlandr::mskeyGears,   fleetDescription = "Fleet",   unkVar = c("MONTH", "NEGEAR", "AREA"),   knStrata = c("HY", "QY", "MONTH", "NEGEAR", "TONCL2", "AREA") )

title: Extracts and processes commercial data from Database — get_comland_data
text: channel Object inherited ROracle::Oracle. object used connect communicate database engine. (see dbutils::connect_to_database) filterByYear numeric vector. Years retrieved (Default = NA, pull years) filterByArea numeric vector. Statistical Areas retrieved (Default = NA, pull areas) useLanded boolean. Use landed live weight shellfish (Default = T, landed) removeParts boolean. Remove species parts (Heads, wings, etc), Default = T useHerringMaine boolean. Pull data Maine Herring database use herring data commercial landings database (Default = T) useForeign boolean. Pull foreign data NAFO. (Default = T) refYear numeric. Reference year use adjusting species value refMonth numeric. Reference month use adjusting species value disagSkatesHakes boolean. Partition skates hake unclassified landings species (Default = T) aggArea boolean. Aggregate Statistical Areas larger spatial units (Default = F) userAreas data frame. Spatial units Statistical areas aggregated (eg. mskeyAreas) areaDescription character string. Field name userAreas denoting spatial unit. (Default = "EPU") propDescription character string. Field name userAreas denoting scaling factor. (Default = "MeanProp") applyProp boolean. Apply proportions userAreas landings value (Default = T) aggGear boolean. Aggregate NEGEAR codes larger "fleets" (Default = F) userGears data frame. Fleet designations NEGEAR codes grouped (eg.  mskeyGears) fleetDescription character string. Field name userGears denoting Fleet. (Default = "Fleet") unkVar character vector. Variables data, missing values, wish assign value . (unkVar = NULL skips assigning unknowns) knStrata character vector. Variables data wish use use assign values unkVar

title: Extracts and processes commercial data from Database — get_comland_data
text: list 3 objects Data frame (data.table) (n x 12) comland row data.table defines group trips fishing YEAR, MONTH, AREA using NEGEAR MESH, sized vessel, TONCL2, catching species (NESPP3) MARKET_CODE purpose (UTILCD). sum landings value returned 'group' YEAR Year trips MONTH Month trips NEGEAR/Fleet Fishing gear used trips aggregated Fleet TONCL2 Tonnage class fishing vessel (2 digit value) NESPP3 Species code (3 characters) MARKET_CODE Market code species caught (2 characters) MESHCAT Code describe mesh size trawl vessel AREA/EPU Statistical area/ Ecological Production Unit species reportly caught UTILCD Utilization code. Eg. utilization code: 0=food fish unknown; 2=aquaculture; 3=canned pet food (1984+); 4=Biomedical (2002+); 5=animal food (1984+); 7=bait; 8=industrial, (2002+); 9=industrial, reduction. US Landing USA vessels foreign vessels SPPLIVMT Weight metric tons. SPPVALUE value landed catch nearest dollar (U.S.), paid fisherman dealer, given species. Character string sql Defines SQL query used pull data Function call call function call used create data

title: Extracts and processes commercial data from Database — get_comland_data
text: arguments rely choice others. aggArea = T user must also supply userAreas data frame areaDescription string denote field userArea maps statistical area larger spatial unit. aggGear = T user must also supply userGears data frame fleetDescription string denote field userGears maps NEGEAR codes fleet designation.

title: Extracts raw commercial data from Database — get_comland_raw_data

code: get_comland_raw_data(   channel,   filterByYear = NA,   filterByArea = NA,   useLanded = T,   removeParts = T )

title: Extracts raw commercial data from Database — get_comland_raw_data
text: channel Object inherited ROracle::Oracle. object used connect communicate database engine. (see dbutils::connect_to_database) filterByYear numeric vector. Years retrieved (Default = NA, pull years) filterByArea numeric vector. Statistical Areas retrieved (Default = NA, pull areas) useLanded boolean. Use landed live weight shellfish (Default = T, landed) removeParts boolean. Remove species parts (Heads, wings, etc), Default = T

title: Extracts raw commercial data from Database — get_comland_raw_data
text: List 2 objects: Data frame (data.table) (n x 12) comland row data.table defines group trips fishing YEAR, MONTH, AREA using NEGEAR MESH, sized vessel, TONCL2, catching species (NESPP3) MARKET_CODE purpose (UTILCD). sum landings value returned 'group' YEAR Year trips MONTH Month trips NEGEAR Three digit Fishing gear code used trips TONCL2 Two digit Tonnage class code fishing vessel NESPP3 Three digit Species code AREA Statistical area species reportly caught UTILCD Utilization code. Eg. utilization code: 0=food fish unknown; 2=aquaculture; 3=canned pet food (1984+); 4=Biomedical (2002+); 5=animal food (1984+); 7=bait; 8=industrial, (2002+); 9=industrial, reduction. MARKET_CODE Species market code (2 characters) SPPVALUE value landed catch nearest dollar (U.S.), paid fisherman dealer, given species. MESHCAT Code describe mesh size trawl vessel (SM,LG,NA) SPPLIVMT Weight metric tons. US Landing USA vessels foreign vessels Character string: sql Defines SQL query used pull data

title: Extracts raw commercial data from Database — get_comland_raw_data
Extracts raw commercial data from Database — get_comland_raw_data

title: Downloads all NAFO data — get_foreign_data
text: filterByYear Numeric vector. Years data required filterByArea Character vector. NAFO Areas data required removeUSA Boolean. USA landings removed data set? (Default = T, remove) aggregateCountry Boolean. catch aggregated country codes? (Default = T)

title: Downloads all NAFO data — get_foreign_data
text: Data frame: NAFO data Year Year catch MONTH Month catch QY Quatere year catch. Jan-Mar = 1, ..., Oct-Dec = 4 GearCode NAFO gear code Tonnage Size class vessel DivCode Division code vessel reported catch Code NAFO species code landed fish SPPLIVMT catch Metric tons Country Reporting country - aggregateCounty = F

title: Downloads all NAFO data — get_foreign_data
code: nafoData <- get_foreign_data(filterByYear = 2000) #> Reading file: nafo-21b-2000-09.zip head(nafoData) #>     Year GearCode Tonnage Divcode  Code MONTH    QY SPPLIVMT #>    <int>    <int>   <int>   <int> <int> <num> <num>    <num> #> 1:  2000        8       5      32   632     0     1        0 #> 2:  2000        8       5      32   632     1     1        0 #> 3:  2000        8       5      32   632     2     1        0 #> 4:  2000        8       5      32   632     3     1        0 #> 5:  2000        8       5      32   632     4     2        0 #> 6:  2000        8       5      32   632     5     2        0

text: channel Object inherited ROracle::Oracle. object used connect communicate database engine. (see dbutils::connect_to_database) ports specific port code set codes. Either numeric character vector. Defaults "" ports. Numeric codes converted VARCHAR2(6 BYTE) creating sql statement. Character codes short character strings referencing PORTNM field.

title: Extract PORT location information from CFDBS — get_ports
text: list returned: data containing result executed sqlStatement sql containing sql call colNames vector table's column names sqlStatement provided default sql statement "select * NEFSC_GARFO.cfdbs_port" used

title: Extract PORT location information from CFDBS — get_ports
text: Use data dictionary field name explanations

title: Extract PORT location information from CFDBS — get_ports
code: if (FALSE) { # \dontrun{ # extracts complete port table based on default sql statement channel <- connect_to_database(server="name_of_server",uid="individuals_username") get_ports(channel)  # extracts port details based on ports 224309 , 224409 (numeric) get_ports(channel,ports = c(224309,224409))  # extracts port details based on ports 224309 , 224409 (character) get_ports(channel,ports = c("224309","224409"))  # extracts port details based on port name (character) get_ports(channel,ports = "Fairfield") get_ports(channel,ports = "Fair")  } # }

what: Extract SPECIES information from CFDBS — get_species
title: Extract SPECIES information from CFDBS — get_species
text: Extract list speices names, code, market category, etc NEFSC cfspp table

title: Extract SPECIES information from CFDBS — get_species
Extract SPECIES information from CFDBS — get_species
text: channel Object inherited ROracle::Oracle. object used connect communicate database engine. (see dbutils::connect_to_database) species specific species code set codes. Either numeric character vector. (NESPP3 codes) Numeric codes converted VARCHAR2(3 BYTE) creating sql statement. Species common name can also supplied. character string used pull SPPNM field. Defaults "" species.

title: Extract SPECIES information from CFDBS — get_species
text: list returned: data containing result executed $sql statement sql containing sql call colNames vector table's column names default sql statement "select * NEFSC_GARFO.cfdbs_cfspp" used

title: Extract SPECIES information from CFDBS — get_species
text: Use data dictionary field name explanations. Note: species codes (NESPP3) stored database VARCHAR2(3 BYTE)

title: Extract SPECIES information from CFDBS — get_species
code: if (FALSE) { # \dontrun{ # extracts complete species table based on custom sql statement channel <- connect_to_database(server="name_of_server",uid="individuals_username") get_species(channel)  # extracts info for cod (081) get_species(channel,species=81)  # extracts info for cod ("COD") get_species(channel,"cod") get_species(channel,"co") get_species(channel,"COD")   # extracts info for cod (081)  and bluefish (023) sqlStatement <- "select * from cfdbs.cfspp" get_species(channel,species= c("081","023")) } # }

what: Extract SPECIES information from CFDBS (SPECIES_ITIS_NE, table) — get_species_itis
title: Extract SPECIES information from CFDBS (SPECIES_ITIS_NE, table) — get_species_itis
text: Extract list species names, code, market category, etc NEFSC_GARFO CFDBS_SPECIES_ITIS_NE table

title: Extract SPECIES information from CFDBS (SPECIES_ITIS_NE, table) — get_species_itis
Extract SPECIES information from CFDBS (SPECIES_ITIS_NE, table) — get_species_itis
text: channel Object inherited ROracle::Oracle. object used connect communicate database engine. (see dbutils::connect_to_database) species specific species code set codes. Either numeric character vector. Defaults "" species. Numeric codes (SPECIES_ITIS, NESPP4) converted VARCHAR2 (6 4 characters respectively) creating sql statement. nameType Character string. Upper lower case. Either "common_name" (default), "scientific_name" "nespp4". Determines type name search .

title: Extract SPECIES information from CFDBS (SPECIES_ITIS_NE, table) — get_species_itis
text: list returned: data containing result executed $sql statement sql containing sql call colNames vector table's column names default sql statement "select * NEFSC_GARFO.cfdbs_SPECIES_ITIS_NE" used

title: Extract SPECIES information from CFDBS (SPECIES_ITIS_NE, table) — get_species_itis
text: Use data dictionary field name explanations.

title: Extract SPECIES information from CFDBS (SPECIES_ITIS_NE, table) — get_species_itis
code: if (FALSE) { # \dontrun{ # extracts complete species table based on custom sql statement channel <- connect_to_database(server="name_of_server",uid="individuals_username") get_species_itis(channel)  # extracts info for cod (164712) get_species_itis(channel,species=164712)  # extracts info for cod ("COD") get_species_itis(channel,"cod") #o r get_species_itis(channel,"co") # or (note also return cockles, calico scallop etc.) get_species_itis(channel,"COD")  # extracts info for cod ("gadus") get_species_itis(channel,"gadus",nameType="scientific_name") #o r get_species_itis(channel,"morh",nameType="scientific_name") #o r get_species_itis(channel,"GADUS",nameType="scientific_name") #o r  #' # extracts info for cod ("0814") market category 4 get_species_itis(channel,"0814",nameType="NESPP4") #o r get_species_itis(channel,814,nameType="NESPP4")   # extracts info for cod (164712)  and bluefish (168559) sqlStatement <- "select * from cfdbs.species_itis_ne" get_species_itis(channel,species= c("164712","168559")) } # }

what: Extract Statistical Areas that comprise species stock definition — get_species_stock_area
title: Extract Statistical Areas that comprise species stock definition — get_species_stock_area
text: Extract list statistical areas STOCKEFF supporting table

title: Extract Statistical Areas that comprise species stock definition — get_species_stock_area
Extract Statistical Areas that comprise species stock definition — get_species_stock_area
text: channel Object inherited ROracle::Oracle. object used connect communicate database engine. (see dbutils::connect_to_database) species specific species code set codes. Either numeric character vector. Defaults "" species. Numeric codes (SPECIES_ITIS) converted VARCHAR2 (6) creating sql statement. stock_name Character string. Upper lower case. abbreviated name stock (default = NULL, pulls stocks). Example "GBK", "EGOM"

title: Extract Statistical Areas that comprise species stock definition — get_species_stock_area
text: list returned: data containing result executed sqlStatement sql containing sql call colNames vector table's column names default sql statement "select * STOCKEFF.V_CF_STOCK_RECENT_STAT_AREA_O" used

title: Extract Statistical Areas that comprise species stock definition — get_species_stock_area
text: Use data dictionary field name explanations

title: Extract Statistical Areas that comprise species stock definition — get_species_stock_area
code: if (FALSE) { # \dontrun{ # extracts complete area table based on default sql statement channel <- connect_to_database(server="name_of_server",uid="individuals_username") get_species_stock_area(channel)  # extracts info for cod (164712) get_species_stock_area(channel,species=164712)  # extracts info for cod ("COD"). All stocks get_species_stock_area(channel,"cod") get_species_stock_area(channel,"co") get_species_stock_area(channel,"COD")  # extracts info for cod (GBK stock) get_species_stock_area(channel,"COD", stock_name = "GBK") get_species_stock_area(channel,"CO", stock_name = "gbk") get_species_stock_area(channel,"164712", stock_name = "EGOM") get_species_stock_area(channel,164712, stock_name = "egom")  # extracts info for cod (164712)  and bluefish (168559) sqlStatement <- "select * from cfdbs.species_itis_ne" get_species_stock_area(channel,species= c("164712","168559"))  } # }

title: comlandr 1.1.0
text: Previous version package pulled deprecated time series. hard coded package lazyloaded dataset, manual updating process. replaced workflow pull data stream via API. ensure even API fails economic data available

title: comlandr 1.1.0
text: Use Federal reserve bank st louis price deflator. https://fred.stlouisfed.org/series/WPU0223. monthly index. adjust_inflation.r edited use data stream. Add argument checks check_argument_validation.r throw error reference values Month /Year fall outside data set. compares data repo new pulled data (compare_fred_data & get_fred) sends email report (sendAsEmail.rmd) Add rmd document schemas used

title: comlandr 1.1.0
text: Many data tables used supporting functions moved NEFSC GARFO (Schema changes). Changes reflect made several get functions refYear refMonth allowed NA NA PR Can either refYear refMonth NA . change data.table resulted string names converted vector use join statements.

title: comlandr 1.1.0
text: get_species_stock_area.r - Extrats statistical areas comprise species stock definition

title: comlandr 1.0.0
text: significant overhaul layout structure package. Many changes internal apparent user

title: comlandr 1.0.0
text: Reworked algorithm assign unknowns. operation now takes place immediately following data pull Changed names reorganzied many internal functions Added functions estimate discards Added lazy loaded datasets mskeyrun project price data Switched underlying data source. WODETS, WOLANDS, CFDETS STOCKEFF (pulls earlier data sources along CAMS)

title: comlandr 0.3.0
text: Standalone functionality pulling NAFO data get_foreign_data - pulls data NAFOs STATLANT 21B database

title: comlandr 0.2.0
text: Added supporting get functions pull information supporting oracle tables get_areas - pull stat area, region, NAFO codes get_gears - pull gear type, codes, description get_vessels - pull tonnage, crew size get_locations - pull lat, lon, 10 min sq. get_ports - pull port names locations get_species - pull species name, market code information get_species_itis - pull species itis information

title: comlandr 0.1.0
